label: [Hannah West case testimonies]: Department of the Interior, Commission to the Five Civilized Tribes, Fort Gibson, I. T., September 4, 1901 [4 copies]

metadata.value: United States. Commission to the Five Civilized Tribes

metadata.label: subject
value: Treaty between the United States of America and the Chiefs, Head Men, and People of the Cherokee Tribe of Indians (1835 December 29)

metadata.label: title
metadata.value: [Hannah West case testimonies]: Department of the Interior, Commission to the Five Civilized Tribes, Fort Gibson, I. T., September 4, 1901 [4 copies]

metadata.label: abstract
metadata.value: Mark Bean, a "Cherokee by blood" and L. B. Bell testify on behalf of Hannah West, a formerly enslaved African American, for enrollment as a Cherokee Freedmen. Both Mark Bean and L.B. Bell testify that they knew Sallie Mayfield, a former Cherokee citizen from Flint District, who relocated to "Russ" [i.e., Rusk] County, Texas in 1847 and returned in 1868 or 1869. Bell testifies that she had moved to Texas due to disturbances "arising out of the treaty of 1835." Finally, both witnesses testify that Sallie was later re-admitted as a citizen of the Cherokee Nation, but that they did not know Hannah, or whether she had been among the persons enslaved by Sallie.

Bell testifies that she had moved to Texas due to disturbances "arising out of the treaty of 1835."
